page.title: 16Shopping in Chapeltown.
page.content: Shopping patterns in Chapeltown have altered radically since ASDA opened, bringing 'One stop shopping'. The superstore opened in 1976. 75% of local people in our survey use it at least once a week. Station Road, with its individual, specialised shops, has become a backwater, with frequent changes of ownership and goods sold. ASDA's positioning is good, with public transport facilities nearby, although most people prefer to use private transport. One criticism is of the positioning of the loading bay - causing traffic congestion in the centre of Chapeltown, especially on Market days, Tuesdays and Fridays. The people surveyed were generally satisfied with the shopping facilities although it was felt a shoe shop was badly needed.
